Half-Life 2: Episode One continues the storyline, picking up right where Half-Life 2 ended (and if you haven't played that, none of the events here will make any sense), and has the same minimalist approach to exposition. I was quickly back in control of Gordon Freeman, courtesy of my mysterious alien allies, dealing with the fallout from my confrontation with Dr. Breen, and trying to evacuate City 17 with my new best friend, Alyx Vance.

Gameplay effectively builds on what existed in Half-Life 2 and has a good variety of exploration, combat, platforming, puzzles and story; I never had an opportunity to pilot any vehicles, but didn't miss it; There's a greater focus on a single AI companion resulting in a lot less opportunity for frustration; There's still a problem with physics objects and platforming, but those sections seem better designed around those flaws and [i]feel[/i] less frustrating; And, again the ending is quite the cliffhanger, though it feels a bit less abrupt compared to its predecessor.

Igényes folytatás, pár nagyobb és mehezebben legyőzhető ellenfeléllel. Tetszik, hogy nincs meg a végső győzelem. Sok mindennek az irányítását átvettünk, mégis ott van a félelem a levegőben, hogy mindent elveszítünk.

+ Ha a társunk szemébe világítunk az elemlámpánkkal, végre nem tetszik neki. :)

Das Spiel ist gut.

Es ist eine relativ kurze Fortsetzung (vielleicht 5h) von Half-Life 2.

Die Handhabung ist genauso wie bei Half-Life, die Grafik hat sich keicht verbessert, die Headcrabs sind etwas schwierigere Gegner geworden.

Markant ist, dass uns (Gordon) permanent Alyx zur Seite steht. Dadurch wird vieles leichter, aber vielleicht nicht besser, weil man oft einfach Alyx die Arbeit überlassen kann. Das ist für mich spielerisch eher weniger gut.

Sonderlich schwer wurde es zu keiner Zeit.

Pro & Contra:

+ Wie Half-Life 2

o Alles irgendwie bekannt

- Wenig Höhepunkte

Wertung: 08/10

Hat man Half-Life 2 gespielt und mochte es, ist dies eine nette Zugabe.
Шедевру не нужны обзоры.

HALF LIFE 2: EPISODIO 1
Desenvolvido pela VALVE e lançado em junho de 2006 para as mesmas plataformas do game principal, Episodio One é uma expansão de HL2 que segue do exato momento em que o segundo game termina.

Depois de sobreviver a explosão inicial da cidadela, Gordon e Alyx conseguem contatar Eli e Kleiner que o avisam que o núcleo da cidadela vai explodir e que eles precisam sair de lá. Os dois então, ao invés de fugir decidem ir até o núcleo e ganhar tempo para que os sobreviventes da guerra que ainda estivessem na cidade pudessem sair. Enquanto estão na cidadela, Alyx encontra uma informação importante que eles precisam entregar a Kleiner e Eli, além de descobrir que Judith esta em apuros.

Veja mais em: http://artificiosequencial.blogspot.com.br/2015/05/ainda-tenho-meia-vida.html

[b]Rank:[/b] 8/10
[b]Recommendation(s):[/b] Play the Half Life series in order.
[b]Major Theme:[/b] A logical part of the Half Life series.
[b]Bought at Price:[/b] $50 – Valve Complete Pack

While I have my own thoughts about Half Life Episode Two, Episode One is a very logical part of the story. Sure, it’s slightly in a tight spot as it takes place right (immediately) after Half Life 2 ends or leaves players on a cliff hanger.

There wasn’t anything “life changing”, or significant for me to take screenshots of, which shows how much Episode One was a tie in. This doesn’t mean that the title is less deserving of its rating, it is just short.

If you are not interested in Half Life, this is not the game to play. Most of the plot will be confusing, and the characters will not be relatable.

¡BASTANTE BUEN JUEGO! Es sin duda una joya de Valve y de los videojuegos, no sé por dónde empezar. Es simplemente genial, al juego le tengo un cariño enorme, recuerdo que a los 10 años ya jugaba HL2, despues supe de los episodios consiguientes tras la explosión del portal en ``Energía Residual`` y no dudé en buscarlos. aunque jamas quise jugarlos piratas, y no fue sino hasta ahora que tengo 16. Es que simplemente me dejó sin palabras. Valve se esmera demasiado con sus juegos y le sale fenomenal. Ahora solo espero a que Half-Life 3 salga. Dios Gabe, me tienes expectante ante noticias de tal maravilla (Me compré todo HL2)

Un point tournant dans la trilogie de Half-Life 2. Ce premier épisode vous embarque dans la citadelle puis dans les rues dévastées de City 17 avant de finir là où tout à commencé, la gare.
Certaine nouveauté sur le gameplay, comme les fusées éclairante, rafraichît le gameplay de la série. 
Et même si le jeu n'est pas très long, il sera vous amuser pendant quelques heures.

하프2와 에피소드 1,2를 다 해본 나로서 의견을 내본다면 역시 하프2시리즈는 다 갓겜이다 .
하지만 하프2 에피소드1의 경우는 물론 갓겜인건 맞지만, 다른 2개의 시리즈에 비해서 단점이 보이기도 했다
그래서 이번작품의 장점과 단점을 여기에 써 보겠다. 내 주관적인 생각이라서 사람들과 차이가 날수 있으니 양해 부탁한다.

장점: 이번작의 장점은 뭐니뭐니해도 모션의 추가라고 생각한다. 모션은 특히 알릭스 밴스에서 잘 나타내어지고 있는데  적(특히 좀비)가 나오면  그냥 총만 쏘던 하프2와는 달리 근접전으로 돌입했을때 발차기를 사용하여 적을 날린다던지 적과 힘 겨루기를 하다가 밀쳐내는 등의 싸움 방식을 보여줬다.
또한 손전등을 비추면 멍하니 보고만 있던 하프2와는 달리 눈이 부시다는 듯 얼굴을 찡그리고 손으로 빛을 막는듯한 행동을 보여 더욱 사람(?) 다운 느낌이 들었다.
난 이런 행동이 왠지 모르게 인상깊어서 틈만 나면 손전등을 밴스한테 비췄다.
.....미안하다 밴스야 

단점: 이건 개인적인 생각인데 이번작에서 가장 짜증나던 챕터가 있었다. 바로 하층민구간인데 칠흑과 같은 어둠속에서 좀비들의 공격에 맞서야 한다. 이게 왜 문제냐면 말 그대로 칠흑과 같은 어둠이다. 손전등을 끄면 아예 아무것도 안 보인다 진짜로..
한마디로 손전등을 켜야 챕터를 진행할수 있는데 손전등의 불빛 범위가 그렇게 넓은게 아니라서 시야가 많이 제한된다. 그렇기 때문에 이 챕터를 처음 플레이 하는 사람이라면 길 찾는데 좀 헤멜거다. 게다가 손전등 배터리가 무한인것도 아니라서 껏다켰다 해야하니 시야에 극단적으로 제한이 있을수 밖에... 이거랑 플레이타임 빼고는 다 괜찮았다

팁을 주자면 만약 당신이 이 작품을 처음 플레이 한다면 반드시 하층민 구간 공략을 보고 해라 물론 케바케이겠지만 난 시야제한 때문에 암 걸릴뻔 했다
Отличое продолжение ко второй халве.

Such a good expansion I played it twice in a row the first time I played it. I just played it for the first time on my Steam and I will be getting all the remaining achievements the second time through tonight, like I did after replaying HL2 and HL2 Update (I mention this because there is an achievement in HL2 and in HL2 EP1 to beat the game without firing more than 1 bullet). The puzzles are more plentiful and mostly more logical. I still feel that Episode One has better pacing and puzzles than HL2. The weapons are the same but the combat has improved and there are more traps and better AI. The auto-save system works better now, saving every 5 minutes max, and won't seem messed up like a few points in HL2. It gives you all new locations from start to finish and more than a few times you get wow'd by the graphics, ten years later I am so damn happy I bought this (on sale), I've patiently been waiting years since the orange box to replay this.
Хоть эпизод получился и короткий, но в нем есть хоть какие-то мотивы, развитие сюжета и завязка, которая дает корни и полноценное состояние второго эпизода.

[h1]Half-Life 2: Episode One[/h1]

[u]Pontos Positivos[/u]

+ Trilha sonora decente.
+ Ambientes muito bons.

[u]Pontos Negativos[/u]

- Extremamente curto (em torno de 2 horas).
- História podia ser melhor.
- Poucas adições.

[h1]Half-Life 2: Episode One recebe a nota 7/10[/h1]

Short, but great sequel to the acclaimed Half Life 2. Worth the money,  defiinitely on sale.

If you collect achivements, none are hard,  or time consuming.

This game is a series of ups and down, which while overall i highly recommend this game seems less then what i was expecting from Valve.

The beginning of the game is by far the worst as it is just a rehash of the ending of 2, except this time you don't feel all of the buildup that made 2's ending so great (of course there was long gap inbetween me playing 2 and this game.)
"The turrets have been here so long they are out of bullets"
After this quote everything picks up, you finally get a gun (you dont get a gun during chapters 1 and 2 besides the gravity gun) you fight zombies and antillions and everything cool, and the game keeps that trend up through the ending of chapter 4 which is where everything got screwed up.

At the end of chapter 4 you fight a helicopter, that went fine and was a really cool boss fight however afterwards Alyx is supposed to come talk to you for the game to progress, which she was busy glitching in a wall and thus didn't. I had to replay the entire 4rth chapter up to this point constantly watching her to make sure everything worked out. it did the second time and luckily the 4rth chapter was a lot of fun to speed run the second time through. Chapter 5 is also fun until...
SPOILERS... (just btw)
BOSS FIGHT: The final boss is a stalker, thats fine except the mechanics of the fight work agansit the fight making it harder then is should be. The gun you use during this fight is the RPG which homes in directly on where you mouse is pointed, since the stalker is constantly shooting you only giving you small intervals to shoot and aim at it. However when you go back into cover the rocket moves right towards your cover killing or seriously injuring you, this happened to me 5 times. Also while i didnt have any trouble with this the window where you can shoot and aim at the stalker is really small which may give you problems.
SPOILERS +RANT OVER
Overall slow start band end boss but overall 8/10 a rating i never though i would give a Valve game but still good.
